meanings.definition: To install or connect (a computer or other electronic device) by means of hardwires.
meanings.sent1: I will hardwire the new printer to the network for faster printing.
meanings.sent2: The technician hardwired the security cameras to ensure a stable connection.
meanings.sent3: Hardwiring the speakers made the music sound like it was coming from all around.
meanings.sent4: She hardwired her dedication to learning, always seeking new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The coach hardwired discipline into the team, leading to their success.

meanings.definition: To establish (something) as a permanent or unchangeable feature or quality.
meanings.sent1: The tradition of family dinners was hardwired into their routine.
meanings.sent2: His love for nature was hardwired into his very being.
meanings.sent3: She hardwired her love for chocolate, always having a stash nearby.
meanings.sent4: The values of honesty and integrity were hardwired into their upbringing.
meanings.sent5: His passion for music was hardwired into every note he played.

meanings.definition: The physical connections that carry signals between different parts of a computer or other electronic device.
meanings.sent1: The hardwiring in the computer ensured fast data transfer.
meanings.sent2: The technician checked the hardwiring to fix the connectivity issue.
meanings.sent3: The hardwiring resembled a complex web of information flowing.
meanings.sent4: The hardwiring acted as the vital link between the components.
meanings.sent5: The intricate hardwiring allowed for seamless communication within the device.
